member.name: M:FftSharp.Filter.LowPass(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Silence frequencies above the given frequency

member.name: M:FftSharp.Filter.HighPass(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Silence frequencies below the given frequency

member.name: M:FftSharp.Filter.BandPass(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Silence frequencies outside the given frequency range

member.name: M:FftSharp.Filter.BandStop(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Silence frequencies inside the given frequency range

member.name: M:FftSharp.IWindow.Create(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generate this window as a new array with the given length. Normalizing will scale the window so the sum of all points is 1.

member.name: M:FftSharp.IWindow.Apply(System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a new array where this window was multiplied by the given signal. Normalizing will scale the window so the sum of all points is 1 prior to multiplication.

member.name: M:FftSharp.IWindow.ApplyInPlace(System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modify the given signal by multiplying it by this window IN PLACE. Normalizing will scale the window so the sum of all points is 1 prior to multiplication.

member.name: P:FftSharp.IWindow.Name
member.summary: Single word name for this window

member.name: P:FftSharp.IWindow.Description
member.summary: A brief description of what makes this window unique and what it is typically used for.

member.name: M:FftSharp.Pad.IsPowerOfTwo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Test if a number is an even power of 2

member.name: M:FftSharp.Pad.ZeroPad(FftSharp.Complex[])
member.summary: Return the input array (or a new zero-padded new one) ensuring length is a power of 2
member.param: array of any length
member.returns: the input array or a zero-padded copy

member.name: M:FftSharp.Pad.ZeroPad(System.Double[])
member.summary: Return the input array (or a new zero-padded new one) ensuring length is a power of 2
member.param: array of any length
member.returns: the input array or a zero-padded copy

member.name: M:FftSharp.Pad.ZeroPad(FftSharp.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the input array zero-padded to reach a final length
member.param: array of any length
pad the array with zeros a the end to achieve this final length
member.returns: a zero-padded copy of the input array

member.name: M:FftSharp.Pad.ZeroPad(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the input array zero-padded to reach a final length
member.param: array of any length
pad the array with zeros a the end to achieve this final length
member.returns: a zero-padded copy of the input array

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.FFT(FftSharp.Complex[])
member.summary: Compute the discrete Fourier Transform (in-place) using the FFT algorithm.
member.param: Data to transform in-place. Length must be a power of 2.

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.FFT(System.Span{FftSharp.Complex})
member.summary: Compute the discrete Fourier Transform (in-place) using the FFT algorithm.
member.param: Data to transform in-place. Length must be a power of 2.

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.FFT_WithoutChecks(System.Span{FftSharp.Complex})
member.summary: High performance FFT function. Complex input will be transformed in place. Input array length must be a power of two. This length is NOT validated. Running on an array with an invalid length may throw an invalid index exception.

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.IFFT(FftSharp.Complex[])
member.summary: Compute the inverse discrete Fourier Transform (in-place) using the FFT algorithm.
member.param: Data to transform in-place. Length must be a power of 2.

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.BitReverse(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reverse the sequence of bits in an integer (01101 -> 10110)

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.FFTfreq(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculate sample frequency for each point in a FFT
member.param: Sample rate (Hz) of the original signal
Number of points to generate (typically the length of the FFT)
Whether or not frequencies are for a one-sided FFT (containing only real numbers)

member.name: M:FftSharp.Transform.FFTfreq(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculate sample frequency for each point in a FFT
member.param: Sample rate (Hz) of the original signal
FFT array for which frequencies should be generated
Whether or not frequencies are for a one-sided FFT (containing only real numbers)

member.summary: Return the distance between each FFT point in frequency units (Hz)

real input (must be an array with length that is a power of 2)

member.name: M:FftSharp.Window.GetWindows
member.summary: Return an array containing all available windows. Note that all windows returned will use the default constructor, but some windows have customization options in their constructors if you create them individually.
